statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Mary's 71, Belmont 60
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Diamon Simpson had 26 points to lead host Saint Mary's to victory over Belmont 71-60 Friday, a win that earned them the Shamrock Classic championship. Two Henry Harris free throws gave Belmont (8-5) a 58-57 lead with 2:39 to play in a seesaw game that saw eight ties and 15 lead changes in the second half. It was Saint Mary's fourth straight Shamrock championship. Simpson, the tournament MVP, put Saint Mary's (8-8) ahead with a basket made after a pass deflected off his teammate, Brett Collins. After a Belmont miss, Simpson, who had a game-high 26, scored again. Saint Mary's 6-foot-4 guard John Winston blocked a shot by Belmont's 6-10 Boomer Herndon, who had 20 points. The Gaels built their lead to five as Tron Smith sank the first two of six consecutive free throws he would make in the game's final 1:07. After Saint Mary's Wayne Hunter was called for a foul, he intercepted a long inbounds pass and scored on a breakaway to give the Gaels an insurmountable lead. Smith had four more free throws and Simpson two before Justin Hare, who finished with 16, sank two free throws for Belmont's final two points. Collins had 16 and Smith 11 for Saint Mary's. Winston, who had only two points, had a team-high eight rebounds, three assists and a steal in addition to his pivotal block. Andy Wicke had 12 for Belmont, all 3-pointers. Belmont overcame a 14-point deficit, scoring 17 straight points late in the first half to hold a 32-31 halftime lead.
